message: Oh crap, sorry guys :) For me, a hacker is someone who works genuinely with computers to make them work better or in another way that it should work. For example optimising a website or an App, creating a piece of snippets. Sometimes, it can be harmful, like creating a software that steals credit cards
So what can we have here? I saw a bunch of iOS SDK building or websites designing (thanks to frameworks). Where can we see real hackers?
I think you may have misunderstood the word 'hacker' in 'Hacker News'
I'm afraid I don't understand the question. What on earth is a 'crypter'?
Yeah, what's your best crypter? I was like a bummer using the VB6 Saddam Crypter. So now I try to use some public ASM/C++ crypters. What about you.
One word : lol; sorry, I didn't explain : a crypter is a really good little piece of programs that obfuscate the code of your malware/snippet in order to make it undetectable by the antiviruses.

Ok. Well, regardless of definitions of hacker (and I'm sure we could argue for hours), I will save you a lot of time by telling you we don't provide instructions or help in any way to questions like yours

While anyone can take part in the discussion in this group, it was set up by and for people from http://news.ycombinator.com - where again I stress, anyone can take part. But we generally stick to certain topics. If you're genuinely interested in who we are I would suggest lurking on that website for a while, read the comments, see what sort of thing goes down
If you are just looking for "real hackers"... viruses, cracks, things of that ilk, you're better off looking elsewhere. Where I don't know - just not here.
